byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ray Rivera and Sharifullah Sahak from Kabul, Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Farouq Jan Mangal from Khost and Scott Shane from Washington.

abstract: Military officials say at least 12 Americans were killed after a Taliban suicide car bomber attacked an armored shuttle bus in Kabul; bombing is single deadliest assault on Americans in the capital since war began, and follows brazen Taliban attacks on American Embassy and NATO headquarters in Kabul one month earlier.
snippet: A Taliban suicide car bomber attacked an armored shuttle bus in the single deadliest assault on Americans in Kabul since the war began.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: A Taliban suicide car bomber attacked an armored shuttle bus in the single deadliest assault on Americans in Kabul since the war began.

headline.main: 12 Americans Die as Blast Hits Bus in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: 12 Americans Killed in Blast In Afghanistan
headline.seo: 12 Americans Killed as Suicide Bomb Hits Bus in Afghanistan
